Over the years, this curiosity turned into a real passion for software engineering. He has a natural ability to understand complex systems and find elegant solutions to technical challenges.

His proudest achievement so far is the creation of a complete desktop automation tool using Python and PyQt6, designed to execute Excel macros faster than VBA. This project demonstrates both his mastery of programming logic and his strong interest in efficiency and automation. StÃ©phane believes that programming is not just about writing code but about crafting tools that genuinely make peopleâ€™s work easier and smarter.

Beyond coding, he has a strong interest in technology applied to real-world productivity. He loves optimizing workflows, improving user experience, and exploring how software can remove repetitive work. He is also curious about AI and automation, two fields he plans to explore further.

In the future, StÃ©phane aims to work at EDF to contribute to technological innovation in the energy sector. Alternatively, he sees himself working as a freelance developer while dedicating time to his musical passion, composing, and experimenting with sound design.
